citeinfo.title: City of Rocks National Reserve Vegetation Mapping Project - Field Plots and Accuracy Assessment Points

descript.abstract: This metadata is for the 2009 vegetation (classification) field plots (spatial database) and 2010 accuracy assessment points (spatial database) created from the sampled vegetation plots collected at City of Rocks National Reserve and Castle Rocks State Park, Idaho.
descript.purpose: Plots were collected to characterize the vegetation communities at City of Rocks National Reserve, Castle Rocks State Park, and vicinity. This GIS layer was created from the GPS coordinates recorded at the center of each plot to map their distribution and location. Accuracy Assessment Points were collected on the ground to calculate the thematic accuracy of the City of Rocks National Reserve vegetation map.
descript.supplinf: This GIS layer was created from the GPS coordinates recorded at each point. The Shapefile was imported to a file geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

spdom.descgeog: City of Rocks National Reserve and environs

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgment of Cogan Technology Inc. and Northwest Management, Inc. would be appreciated in products derived from these data. Any person using the information presented here should fully understand the data collection and compilation process before beginning their analysis/use. The burden of determining fitness for use lies with the user.
idinfo.datacred: Dan Cogan (Cogan Technology Inc.), John Erixson (Northwest Management Inc.) and Lisa Garrett (NPS-UCBN).
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: Positional Accuracy is only as good as the GPS Receiver used. Thematic accuracy was not checked for this layer. Thematic data was collected on the ground by trained ecologists.

dataqual.logic: All point features were checked for uniqueness and for correct and complete attributing.
dataqual.complete: All field plots collected in 2009 and all accuracy assessment points at City of Rocks National Reserve and Castle Rocks State Park, Idaho are included in this coverage.

horizpa.horizpar: GPS accuracy varies for each plot.

qhorizpa.horizpae: Uncorrected GPS points recorded with a handheld, commercial GPS receiver.

vertacc.vertaccr: GPS accuracy varies for each plot.

qvertpa.vertacce: Uncorrected GPS points recorded with a handheld, commercial GPS receiver.

procstep.procdesc: Plots were subjectively placed by qualified ecologists to characterize the plant communities. Portions of the methodology were derived from the NPS Vegetation Inventory Program's Field Methods standard. Vegetation data in each sample plot was recorded by qualified ecologists using a standard NVC plot data collection form and PDAs. Data was transferred to a MS Access database. Point coverage was created by importing the database into ArcView as an event theme.

Points were located using a stratified random sampling method. Portions of the methodology were derived from the NPS Vegetation Inventory Program's Accuracy Assessment Procedures. Vegetation data at each point was recorded by qualified ecologists using a standard NVC Point data collection form. Data was transferred to a MS Access database. Point coverage was created by importing the database into ArcView as an event theme.
The shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for this Accuracy Assessment, Observation or Plot point
Point type (accuracy assessment point, observation point or plot point)

enttyp.enttypd: Defines relationship between Veg points and basic AA/plot attributes

overview.eaover: Attributes were either generated by ArcInfo/ArcView software or assigned by Northwest Management, Inc. or Cogan Technology, Inc.
overview.eadetcit: Erixson, J., D. Cogan. 2011. City of Rocks National Reserve Vegetation Inventory Project Natural Resource Report. A Report for the Upper Columbia Basin Network. National Park Service.

distinfo.distliab:

The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. Mention of trade names or commercial products in this metadata report does not constitute endorsement or recommendation for use by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U. S. Geological Survey and National Park Service.
